intro: Euphrasia curta subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the short euphrasia, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth, glabrous surface. It is often found in the northeastern United States and parts of southeastern Canada.
